text:
Environment: Tomcat 4.1.24 or 4.1.18 / Win2k or NT
xindice 1.1b checked out via anoncvs 2003-06-20

after starting xindice-rpc-server on tomcat, i can add collections via 
commandline (xindice ac -c /db) or via xmldbgui-client. Those collections are 
added properly as shown in the tomcat logfiles. Viewing the Sysymbol.tbl and 
SysConfig.tbl with an hex-editor (Ultraedit) , the new collection was added.

After tomcat shutdown, the change is still in SysConfig.tbl.
A System.out.println of database.xml via XMLSerializer (document) in 
Database::flusConfig shows the
same for Database::close.

On startup of tomcat, a System.out.println of database.xml misses the added
collection.

I presume a problem in compression/decompression of that document.


The problem does not occur, if i stop tomcat and add a collection using
commandline (as if it would be a local database xindice ac -l -d(absolute path))
or i use xmldbgui with xindice-embed to access the database locally. Under this 
condition, the collections are available after starting tomcat (XindiceServlet, 
commandline or xmldbgui)


A xindice.log written by tomcat 4.1.18 shows the adding of an addressbook 
collection to an empty database and the lose after restart of tomcat.

text:
Created attachment 6985
Tomcat 4.1.18 server.xml to run xindice as a webapp
creator: u.helmke@innobis.de

text:
Created attachment 6987
SysConfig.tbl with addressbook collection
creator: u.helmke@innobis.de
vgritsenko@apache.org
text:
Cannot reproduce with the currect xindice. I'd tried:

  xindice start
  bin\xindice ac -c /db -n test
  bin\xindice lc -c /db
(shows newly created collection)

Now, stop xindice (Ctrl+C) and start again:
  xindice start
  bin\xindice lc -c /db

Correctly shows all three collections (system, meta, test).

Vadim
